intro: Nemacladus glandulifer var. australis, commonly known as the Australian glandular nemacladus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal regions. This species is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
